abbreviations: Dc2tog = (Yoh and draw up a loop in next stitch. Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook.
Dc3tog = (Yoh and draw up a loop in next stitch. Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) 3 times. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook.
Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 stitches. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook.
Tr2tog = [(Yoh) twice. Draw up a loop in next stitch. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice] twice. Yoh and draw through all 3 loops on hook.
gauge: 7 sc and 4 rows = 4" [10 cm]
instructions:
Notes: 
• Playmat is worked as 2 separate 
layers and joined together in 
Finishing. 
• Both sides of Playmat use Leaf instructions, with different Stripe Pat rep. 


• Playmat worked from top-down. 
• Ch 3 at beg of rows counts as dc. 
• Ch 4 at beg of rows counts as tr. 
• Move marker at end of each row 
to center st as work progresses 
(center st of 5-dc or 3-sc group). Leaf Stripe Pat 1 With A, work 10 rows. With C, work 10 rows. With B, work 14 rows. These 34 rows form Leaf Stripe Pat 1. Leaf Stripe Pat 2 Note: Carry repeated colors loosely 
up side of work. (With A, work 2 rows. Join C. With 
C, work 2 rows. Join A) 4 times. Break C. (With A, work 2 rows. Join B. 
With B, work 2 rows. Join A) 4 times. Break B. With A, work 2 rows. These 34 rows form 
Leaf Stripe Pat 2. LEAF (Make 1 in Stripe Pat 1. 
Make 1 in Stripe Pat 2) With A, ch 5. See Stripe Pat. 
1st row: (RS). 5 dc in 4th ch from hook. (skipped ch-3 counts as dc). PM on center dc of 5-dc group. 1 dc in last ch. Turn. 7 dc. 2nd row: Ch 3. 1 dc in each of next 
2 dc. 5 dc in marked dc. 1 dc in each 
dc to end of row. Turn. 4 sts inc’d. 
11 dc. 3rd row: Ch 3. 1 dc in next dc. 1 dc 
in each dc to marked dc. 5 dc in 
marked dc. 1 dc in each dc to end 
of row. Turn. 4 sts inc’d. 15 dc. 
4th row: As 3rd row. 19 dc. 5th row: Ch 3. 1 dc in first dc - beg 
inc made. 1 dc in each dc to marked 
dc. 5 dc in marked dc. 1 dc in each dc 
to last dc. 2 dc in last dc. Turn. 
6 sts inc’d. 25 dc. 6th and 7th rows:  As 5th row. 
37 sts. 8th to 13th rows:  As 3rd row. 
61 sts. 14th row:  Ch 3. Dc2tog. 
1 dc in each dc to marked dc. 5 dc in 
marked dc. 1 dc in each dc to last 
3 dc. Dc2tog. 1 dc in last dc. Turn. 
2 sts inc’d. 63 sts. 15th row: As 3rd row. 67 sts. 
16th row: As 14th row. 69 sts. 17th row: Ch 4. Tr2tog. 1 tr in each 
of next 2 sts. 1 dc in each dc to 
marked dc. 5 dc in marked dc. 1 dc 
in each dc to last 5 sts. 1 tr in each of 
next 2 sts. Tr2tog. 1 tr in last st. Turn. 
2 sts inc’d. 71 sts. 18th row: Ch 4. Tr2tog. 1 tr in each 
of next 2 sts. 1 dc in each of next 
20 sts. 1 hdc in each of next 5 sts. 
1 sc in each of next 5 sts. 3 sc in 
marked st. 1 sc in each of next 5 sts. 
1 hdc in each of next 5 sts. 1 dc in 
each of next 20 sts. 1 tr in each of 
next 2 sts. Tr2tog. 1 tr in last st. Turn. 
19th row: As 18th row. 20th row: Ch 4. Tr2tog. 1 tr in each 
of next 2 sts. 1 dc in each of next 
15 sts. 1 hdc in each of next 10 sts. 
1 sc in each of next 5 sts. 3 sc in 
marked st. 1 sc in each of next 5 sts. 
1 hdc in each of next 10 sts. 1 dc in 
each of next 15 sts. 1 tr in each of 
next 2 sts. Tr2tog. 1 tr in last st. Turn. 
21st to 28th rows:  As 20th row. 29th row: Ch 3. Dc3tog. 1 dc in each dc to 
marked st. 5 dc in marked st. 1 dc in each st to last 
4 sts. Dc3tog. 1 dc in last st. Turn. 
30th row: As 29th row. 31st row:  Ch 1. 1 sc in first st. 
(Sc2tog) twice. 1 sc in next st. 
*1 hdc in each of next 7 sts. 1 dc 
in each of next 9 sts. 1 hdc in each 
of next 7 sts.** 1 sc in each of next 
6 sts. 3 sc in marked st. 1 sc in each 
of next 6 sts. Rep from * to **. 1 sc 
in next st. (Sc2tog) twice. 1 sc in last 
st. Turn. 2 sts dec’d. 69 sts. 32nd row:  Ch 1. 1 sc in first st. 
(Sc2tog) twice. 1 sc in next st. 
*1 hdc in each of next 7 sts. 1 dc 
in each of next 9 sts. 1 hdc in each 
of next 7 sts.** 1 sc in each of next 
5 sts. 3 sc in marked st. 1 sc in each 
of next 5 sts. Rep from * to **. 1 sc 
in next st. (Sc2tog) twice. 1 sc in last 
sc. Turn. 2 sts dec’d. 67 sts. 33rd row: Sl st in each of first 5 sts. 
1 sc in next st. *1 hdc in each of 
next 7 hdc. 1 dc in each of next 
9 sts. 1 hdc in each of next 7 sts.** 
Sl st in each of next 4 sts. 3 sl st in 
marked st. Sl st in each of next 4 sts. 
Rep from * to **. 1 sc in next st. Sl st 
in each of last 5 sts. Turn. 34th row: Ch 1. Sl st in each of first 
5 sts. 1 sc in next st. *1 hdc in each 
of next 7 sts. 1 dc in each of next 
9 sts. 1 hdc in each of next 7 sts.** 
Sl st in each of next 3 sts. 3 sl st in 
marked st. Sl st in each of next 3 sts. 
Rep from * to **. 1 sc in next st. Sl st 
in each of last 5 sts. For Leaf Stripe Pat 
1, fasten off. For Leaf Stripe Pat 2, do not fasten off. FINISHING Joining rnd: Stack 2 Leaves WS tog. 
With A, ch 1. With Leaf Stripe Pat 2 as top, sc evenly around edges of Leaves, working through both thicknesses and working 3 sc at each corner. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off. Vertical Surface Sl St Line:  With RS facing, join A with sl st to center of last row. Working through both thicknesses and keeping yarn at back of work, sl st along center sts to create a straight vertical line of surface sl sts up to opposite edge 
of Leaf. Take care to align the center 
of both layers and sl st loosely to avoid pulling in work as you stitch. 
Fasten off. FRONT BACK

instructions: With 1 strand of each shade held tog, cast on 93 sts. 1st row:(RS). *K3. P3. Rep from * to last 3 sts. K3. 2nd row: *P3. K3. Rep from * to last 3 sts. P3. 3rd and 4th rows: As 1st row. 5th row: As 2nd row. 6th row: As 1st row. Rep 1st to 6th rows for pat until work from beg measures approx 34 ins [86.5 cm], ending with a 6th row of pat. instructions: With 4 strands tog, cast on 53 sts. 1st row: (RS). K1. *P1. K1. Rep from * to end of row. Rep last row of Seed St Pat 11 times more. Beg with a knit row, work 6 rows in stocking st (knit on RS and purl on WS). Cont in Seed St Pat until work from beg measures 31 ins [78.5 cm], ending with RS facing for next row. Work 6 rows in stocking st. Work 12 rows in Seed St Pat. Cast off in pat. Fringe: Cut yarn 6 ins [15 cm] long. Taking 3 strands tog, fold in half and knot into fringe ¾ inch [2 cm] apart across cast on and cast off edges of Rug. Trim fringe evenly to 1½ inch [4 cm] long.

instructions: With 3 strands of MC, cast on 61 sts. 1st row: (RS). K1. *P1. K1. Rep from * to end of row. This row forms seed st pat. instructions: FACE With 2 strands of MC held tog and larger hook, ch 4. Join with sl st to first ch to form ring. 1st rnd: Ch 3. 11 dc in ring. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. 12 dc. 2nd rnd: Ch 3. 1 dc in first dc. 2 dc in each dc around. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. 24 dc. 3rd rnd: Ch 3. 1 dc in first dc. 1 dc in next dc. *2 dc in next dc. 1 dc in next dc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. 36 dc. 4th rnd: Ch 3. 1 dc in first dc. 1 dc in each of next 2 dc. *2 dc in next dc. 1 dc in each of next 2 dc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. 48 dc. 5th rnd: Ch 3. 1 dc in first dc. 1 dc in each of next 3 dc. *2 dc in next dc. 1 dc in each of next 3 dc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. 60 dc. 6th rnd: Ch 3. 1 dc in first dc. 1 dc in each of next 4 dc. *2 dc in next dc. 1 dc in each of next 4 dc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. 72 dc. 7th rnd: Ch 3. 1 dc in first dc. 1 dc in each of next 5 dc. *2 dc in next dc. 1 dc in each of next 5 dc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. 84 dc. 8th rnd: Ch 3. 1 dc in first dc. 1 dc in each of next 6 dc. *2 dc in next dc. 1 dc in each of next 6 dc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. 96 dc. 9th rnd: Ch 3. 1 dc in first dc. 1 dc in each of next 7 dc. *2 dc in next dc. 1 dc in each of next 7 dc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. 108 dc. Cont as established, inc 12 sc every rnd until piece measures approx 35" [89 cm] in diameter. Fasten off. EARS (make 2) With 2 strands of MC held tog and larger hook, ch 18. 1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 17 sc. 2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn. 3rd row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each sc to last 2 sc. Sc2tog. Turn. 15 sts. 4th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st to end of row. Turn. Rep last 2 rows to 3 sts. Next row: Ch 1. Sc3tog. Fasten off. INNER EAR (make 2) With 1 strand of B and smaller hook, ch 14. 1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 13 sc. 2nd row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each sc to last 2 sc. Sc2tog. 11 sts. 3rd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st to end of row. Turn. Rep last 2 rows to 3 sts. Next row: Ch 1. Sc3tog. Fasten off. Sew Inner Ear to Ear as shown in picture. EYES (make 2) With 1 strand of A and smaller hook, ch 4. **1st rnd: 9 dc in 4th ch from hook. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. 10 dc. 2nd rnd: Ch 3 (counts as dc). 1 dc in first dc (counts as 2 dc). 2 dc in each dc around. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. 20 dc.** 3rd rnd: Ch 3 (counts as dc). 1 dc in first dc (counts as 2 dc). 1 dc in next dc. *2 dc in next dc. 1 dc in next dc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. 30 dc. Fasten off. PUPIL (make 2) With 1 strand of MC and smaller hook, ch 4. Work from ** to ** as given for Eye. Fasten off. Sew Pupil to Eye as shown in picture. NOSE With 1 strand of B and smaller hook, ch 9. 1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 8 sc. 2nd row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each sc to last 2 sc. Sc2tog. Turn. 6 sts. 3rd row: As 2nd row. 4 sts. 4th row: Ch 1. (Sc2tog) twice. 2 sts. 5th row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. Do not fasten off. Ch 1. Work 1 rnd of sc around 3 edges, working 3 sc in each corner. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off. FINISHING Sew Eyes, Nose and Ears to Face as shown in picture. Mouth With 2 strands of A and smaller hook, ch 30. Fasten off. With 2 strands of A and smaller hook, ch 15. Fasten off. Sew longer chain to Face, starting at tip of Nose and curving up to form Mouth. Sew shorter chain to form other side of Mouth. Whiskers (make 4) With 2 strands of A and smaller hook, ch 12. Fasten off. Sew 2 Whiskers on either side of face as shown in picture.

instructions: Notes: Work with 2 strands of yarn throughout. When changing colors, work to last 2 loops on hook. Draw new color through loops and continue. With 2 strands of A, ch 2. 1st rnd: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join B with sl st to first sc. 2nd rnd: With B, ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. 12 sc. Join D with sl st to first sc. 3rd rnd: With D, ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. 18 sc. Join B with st st to first sc. 4th rnd: With B, ch 1. *1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. 24 sc. Join A with sl st to first sc. 5th rnd: With A, ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * around. 30 sc. Join A with sl st to first sc. 7th rnd: With A, ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. Rep from * around. 42 sc. Join B with sl st to first sc. materials: 9 balls of RED HEART Pomp-a-Doodle in color Meadow A
1 skein of RED HEART Super Saver in color White B
Susan Bates Crochet Hook: 5mm [US H-8]
Non-slip gridded rug pad, 40" x 60"
Yarn needle
gauge: Gauge is not critical for this project
instructions: Use Pomp-a-Doodle yarn to create a non-slip oval rug by working slip stitches and double crochets into the spaces of the rug pad. The rug is worked with the wrong side facing throughout, starting with a line in the center and spiraling out to the edges. NOTE Rug is made by working slip stitches and double crochets into the spaces of rug pad. As rug pads vary by manufacturer, the number of stitches used in each string section may vary as well. It is worked with wrong side facing throughout. First, a line is worked in the center of rug pad. Then, piece is worked in a spiral manner around to the outside edges. RUG Prep Rug Pad With wrong side facing, measure a 13" [33 cm] line in center of rug pad, marking both ends with a marker or pen. Join A to Rug Pad With wrong side facing and holding A underneath the rug pad, insert hook into hole closest to one end of marked line on your rug pad. Working with string sections between pompoms, yarn over using string section between first pompom at end and next pompom. Pull that loop through rug pad so first pompom is held close to underside of rug pad fabric. Insert hook in next pad hole along that line and yarn over with same section of string, pull that loop through rug pad and through previous loop on hook to make a slip stitch. Insert hook in next pad hole, yarn over with next section of string, pull through rug pad and through previous loop on hook, pulling second pompom close to rug pad.Continue working slip stitches along this line until 13" [33 cm] have been worked. Turn work in a 90-degree angle and work stitches for 1" [2.5 cm] from long line. Turn work 90-degrees again to work parallel to original line, leaving 1" [2.5 cm] space between lines and work slip stitches in a line. When this line is 1" [2.5 cm] longer than previous line, turn to work along opposite edge of previous line, maintaining 1" [2.5 cm] distance from previous stitches. Continue in an Oval Continue working like this, working 2 or 3 slip stitches for each string section, while curving around rug pad in an oval. Adding a New Ball of Yarn To add a new ball, pull up second loop of string before last pompom. Insert hook in next rug pad hole and pull up loop in string section between first two pompoms of new ball of yarn. Pull this loop through previous loop on the hook from last ball and continue working. Sew string left after each final pompom to tack it securely to rug pad. Finishing the Pomp-a-doodle Section When rug has reached desired dimensions. cut off very last pompom and use string section to pull through final stitch. Weave in ends. Trim Rug Pad Cut excess rug pad around rug, leaving 1" [2.5 cm] outside of final round. Edging With right side facing, join B in any hole along outside edge of rug pad with a slip stitch, chain 3, double crochet evenly spaced around outside edges of rug pad, trimming off any little squares that want to poke through and adding extra stitches at corners and curves as needed. Slip stitch to top of beginning chain-3. Fasten off.

materials: RED HEART® “Eco-Cotton™ Blend”: 3 balls Denim A and 1001 Snow B
Crochet Hook: 6.5 mm[US K-10.5] and 6 mm [US J-10]
Yarn needle
abbreviations: *or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
measurements: Rug measures 24” wide x 31” long without fringe
gauge: 9 sts = 4”; 8 rows = 3” in pattern with larger hook and 2 strands held together. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge
instructions: STRIP 1 (Make 3): With larger hook and A ch 12 loosely. Row 1 (Right Side): Draw up a loop in 2nd ch from hook and in next ch, yo and draw through all 3 loops on hook, * draw up a loop in same ch as last leg of last st and in next ch, yo and through all 3 loops on hook; repeat from * across; sc in same ch as last leg of last st; turn – 11 sts. Row 2: Ch 1, draw up a loop in first 2 sts, yo and draw through all 3 loops on hook, * draw up a loop in same st as last leg of last st and in next st, yo and through all 3 loops on hook; repeat from * across; sc in same st as last leg of last st; turn – 11 sts. Rows 3-12: Repeat row 2 changing to B in last sc of Row 12. Now work 12 rows in pattern with B, then 12 rows with A. Repeat the last 24 rows twice more – 7 blocks. Fasten off. STRIP 2 (Make 2): Work same as Strip 1 reversing color placement. FINISHING: Sew strips together as pictured. With right side facing, smaller hook and A, work 1 rnd sc evenly around rug working 3 sc in each corner; join. Fasten off. Weave in ends. Optional: Cut 7” lengths of A and knot into a fringe on each short end of rug. Trim.

Join. 24 sc. 5th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 30 sc. 6th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 36 sc. 7th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 42 sc. 8th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 48 sc. 9th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 7 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 54 sc. 0th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 4 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 60 sc.** 11th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 9 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 66 sc. 12th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 5 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 72 sc. 13th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 8 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 80 sc. 14th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 5 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 88 sc. Cont as established, inc 8 sts per rnd to 224 sc. Fasten off. Place markers for Paws on the following sts of last rnd: 19th, 79th, 131st and 191st. PAWS First Paw: With RS facing, join MC with sl st to first marker on last rnd of Body. 1st to 12th rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 16 sc. Turn. 13th row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 12 sc. Sc2tog. 14 sc. Turn. 14th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn. 15th row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 10 sc. Sc2tog. 12 sc. Turn. 16th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn 17th row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 8 sc. Sc2tog. 10 sc. Turn. 18th row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 6 sc. Sc2tog. 8 sc. Fasten off. Second, Third and Fourth Paws: Work as given for First Paw, joining yarn at each additional marker. Surface Sl st Claws: With 2 strands of black Bernat® Softee Chunky™, join yarn with sl st to center of last row of Paw. Keeping yarn at back of work (WS), sl st down into rows below to create a straight vertical line of surface sl sts 3” [7.5 cm] long, taking care to sl st loosely to avoid pulling in work as you stitch. Fasten off. Rep to create 2 more Claws evenly spaced on either side of first Claw. HEAD Front and Back (make 2 pieces alike) With MC, work from ** to ** as given for Body. Do not fasten off at end of second Head piece (Front). Place Front and Back tog with WS facing each other, and Front facing. Joining rnd: Ch 1. Working through both thicknesses, 1 sc in each sc around, inserting stuffing halfway through rnd. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off. MUZZLE With A, work from ** to *** as given for Body. Fasten off. EARS (Make 2 each with MC and A). Ch 2. 1st row: 5 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 5 sc. Turn. 2nd row: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc to end of row. 10 sc. Turn. 3rd row: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * to end of row. 15 sc. Turn. 4th row: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * to end of row. 20 sc. Fasten off. Join Ears: Hold 1 MC Ear and 1 A Ear tog with WS facing each other. With A Ear facing, join MC to first sc. Ch 1. Working through both thicknesses, 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Fasten off, leaving a long end for sewing to Head. TAIL With A, ch 2. 1st rnd: 8 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join. 8 sc 2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join. 16 sc. 3rd to 6th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join. Fasten off, leaving a long end for sewing to Body. Stuff Tail lightly. FINISHING Sew Muzzle and Ears to Head as seen in photo. With black Bernat® Softee Chunky™ yarn, embroider Nose and Eyes with Satin St and Mouth with Stem St as seen in photo. Sew Head to Body, centering between First and Fourth Paws as seen in photo. Sew Tail to Body as seen in photo.

materials: RED HEART® With Love®: 2 skeins each 1803 Blue Hawaii E and 1538 Lilac F and 1 skein each 1701 Hot Pink A, 1252 Mango B, 1201 Daffodil C, 1562 Jadeite D
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 6mm [US J-10]
Yarn needle
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, Color B, Color C, etc.
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated
instructions:
RUG
With A, ch 4.
Round 1: Work 11 dc in 3rd ch from hook (beginning ch count as first dc); join with slip st in top of beginning ch—12 dc.
Round 2: Ch 3 (counts as first dc here and throughout), Fpdc around same st as join, *dc in next dc, Fpdc around same dc; repeat from * around; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—12 dc and 12 Fpdc.
Round 3: Ch 3, dc in same st as join, Fpdc around next Fpdc, *2 dc in next dc, dc around next Fpdc; repeat from * around; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—24 dc and 12 Fpdc.
Round 4: Ch 3, dc in same st as join, dc in next dc, Fpdc around next Fpdc, *2 dc in next dc, dc in next dc, dc around next Fpdc; repeat from * around; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—36 dc and 12 Fpdc.
Round 5: Ch 3, dc in same st as join, dc in next 2 dc, Fpdc around next Fpdc, *2 dc in next dc, dc in next 2 dc, dc around next Fpdc; repeat from * around; change to B; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—48 dc and 12 Fpdc. Round 6: Ch 3, dc in same st as join, dc in each dc to next Fpdc, Fpdc around next Fpdc, *2 dc in next dc, dc in each dc to next Fpdc, Fpdc around next Fpdc; repeat from * around; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—60 dc and 12 Fpdc. Rounds 7–9: Ch 3, dc in same st as join, dc in each dc to next Fpdc, Fpdc around next Fpdc, *2 dc in next dc, dc in each dc to next Fpdc, Fpdc around next Fpdc; repeat from * around; change to C; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—96 dc and 12 Fpdc. Rounds 10–25: Repeat Rounds 6–9 four times, changing colors in the following sequence: Work 4 rounds with C, 4 rounds with D, 4 rounds with E, and 4 rounds with F—288 dc and 12 Fpdc. Fasten off. FINISHING Weave in ends.

materials: Lily® Sugar'n Cream ® (Solids: 2.5 oz/70.9 g; 120 yds/109 m, Twists: 2 oz/56.7 g; 95 yds/86 m)
Main Color (MC) Green Twists (20244) 6 balls
Contrast A Hot Green (01712) 2 balls
Contrast B White (00001) 6 balls
Size U.S. J/10 (6 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
gauge: 10 sc and 11 rows = 4' [10 cm].
instructions: Center Section: With MC, ch 42. 1st row: (WS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of ch. Turn. 41 sc. 2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. * 1 tr in next sc. 1 sc in next sc (push long post of previous tr to front of work). Rep from * to end of row. Turn. 3rd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st to end of row. Turn. 4th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 2 sc. *1 tr in next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * to last sc. 1 sc in last sc. Turn. 5th row: As 3rd row. Turn. Rep last 4 rows until work from beg measures 12' [30.5 cm], ending with 3rd or 5th row. Fasten off. Note: Join all rnds of Edging with sl st to first st. Edging: 1st rnd: (RS). Join A with sl st to top right corner. Ch 2 (does not count as st). 1 sc in each of next 40 sc. 3 sc in last sc (corner). 28 sc down left side to bottom corner. 3 sc in corner. 1 sc in each of next 39 rem loops of foundation ch. 3 sc in next st. 28 sc up right side to top corner. 2 sc in first sc. Join. Turn. 2nd rnd: (WS). Ch 1. Working in back loops only, *1 sc in each sc to corner sc. 3 sc in corner sc. Rep from * around. Join. Turn. 3rd rnd: (RS). Ch 1. Working in back loops only, *1 sc in each sc to corner sc. 3 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join B. Do not turn. 4th rnd: With B, ch 3. Working in both loops, *1 hdc in each sc to corner sc. (1 hdc. Ch 8. 1 hdc) in corner sc. Rep from * around. Join. 5th rnd: Ch 2. *Yoh and draw up a loop around post of next st at front of work inserting hook from right to left. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice - 1 dcfp made. 1 dcfp in each st to last hdc before ch-8 sp. (1 dcfp. 1 hdc) in next hdc. Ch 8. (1 hdc. 1 dcfp) in next hdc. Rep from * around. Join. Rep last rnd for 4' [10 cm] total, having 2 more sts at each corner on every rnd. Next rnd: Ch 2. *1 dcfp in each st to last hdc before ch-8 sp. (1 hdc. 1 dcfp) in next hdc. Ch 8. (1 hdc. 1 dcfp) in next hdc. Rep from * around. Join. Pull ch-8 loops as follows: from 6th rnd through 5th rnd, from 7th rnd through 6th rnd, from 8th rnd through 7th rnd. Rep in same manner for all ch-8 loops of rem rnds as shown in picture. Next rnd: Ch 2. *1 sc in each st to 1 hdc before ch-8 sp. 2 sc in next hdc. 5 sc in next ch-8 sp. 2 sc in next hdc. Rep from * around. Join. Next rnd: Ch 1. Working from left to right, instead of from right to left as usual, work 1 reverse sc in each sc around. Join. Fasten off.

materials: Bernat® Maker Big™ (8.8 oz/250 g; 77 yds/70 m) Main Color (MC) Deep Teal (25014) 6 balls
Bernat® Softee® Chunky™ (3.5 oz/100 g; 108 yds/99 m) Contrast A Seagreen (28219) 3 balls
Size U.S. Q/19 (15 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge. Stitch marker.
gauge: 5 sc and 5 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions: RUG Notes • Do not join at ends of rnds. Cont working in spiral placing marker on first st of rnd for easier counting. • Block Rug (see Finishing) before applying fringe. With MC, ch 2. 1st rnd: 8 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 8 sc. 2nd rnd: 2 sc in each sc around. 16 sts. 3rd rnd: *1 sc in next st. 2 sc in next st. Rep from * around. 24 sts. 4th rnd: *1 sc in each of next 2 sts. 2 sc in next st. Rep from * around. 32 sts. 5th rnd: *1 sc in each of next 3 sts. 2 sc in next st. Rep from * around. 40 sts. 6th rnd: *1 sc in each of next 4 sts. 2 sc in next st. Rep from * around. 48 sts. 7th to 18th rnds: Cont in this manner, inc 8 sts evenly around each rnd, until there are 144 sts. 19th to 21st rnds: 1 sc in each st around. 22nd rnd: 1 sc in each st around. Sl st in first sc. Fasten off.  FINISHING Blocking: Pin Rug to measurements. Cover with a damp cloth, leaving cloth to dry. Fringe: Cut strands of A 12" [30.5 cm] long. Taking 3 strands tog, fold in half and knot into fringe through each st around edge of Rug. Trim fringe evenly.

materials: RED HEART® Super Saver®: 2 Skeins each 320 Cornmeal, 633 Dark Sage, and 4 skeins 631 Light Sage
Crochet Hook: U.S. Sizes N-15 [10 mm] and J-10 [6 mm]
gauge: 8 sts = 5” with larger hook and 4 strands held together
instructions: 1. With larger hook and 4 strands of C, ch 2. Round 1 (Wrong Side): 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook; join with a slip st in first sc; turn – 6 sc. Round 2: Ch 1; yo and insert hook into first sc, yo and draw loop through st and through one loop on hook, yo and draw loop through remaining 2 loops on hook – long hdc made; long hdc in same sc, [2 long hdc in next sc] 5 times; join with a slip st in first st; turn – 12 sts. Round 3: Ch 1, [2 sc in next st, sc in next st] 6 times; join with a slip st in first sc; turn – 18 sc. Round 4: Ch 1, [2 long hdc in next sc, long hdc in next 2 sc] 6 times; join with a slip st in first st; turn – 24 sts. Round 5: Ch 1, [2 sc in next st, sc in next 3 sts] 6 times; join with a slip st in first sc; turn – 30 sc. Round 6: Ch 1, [2 long hdc in next sc, long hdc in next 4 sc] 6 times; join with a slip st in first st; turn – 36 sts. Round 7: Ch 1, [2 sc in next st, sc in next 5 sts] 6 times; join with a slip st in first sc; turn – 42 sc. Rounds 8-23: Repeat rounds 6-7, increasing 6 sts each round and alternating long hdc on right side rounds and sc on wrong side rounds; change to 4 strands of A in last st of last row. There will be 138 sts at end of Round 23. Fasten off C. Continue in pattern as before and work 2 rounds with A, then 4 rounds with B, then 2 rounds with A. There will be 186 sts at end of last round. Fasten off. Weave in ends. Motif (Make 12): With smaller hook and 2 strands of A held together as one, [ch 10, slip st in 10th ch from hook] 3 times. Fasten off. Sew motifs to the B band as pictured.

materials: Bernat® Handicrafter Cotton(50 g/1.75 oz)
Main Color (MC):(Blue) 13 balls
Contrast A:(Yellow) 4 balls
Contrast B:(Green) 9 balls
Size 10 mm (U.S. N or 15) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
gauge: 7 dc and 4 rows = 4 ins [10 cm] with 3 strands of yarn
instructions: Stripe Pat Work 10 rnds with MC. Work 2 rnds with B. Work 2 rnds with MC. Work 2 rnds with A. Work 2 rnds with MC. Work 1 rnds with B. These 19 rnds form Stripe Pat. With 3 strands of MC, ch 20. 1st rnd:(RS). 1 dc in 4th ch from hook. 1 dc in each of next 15 ch. 5 dc in last ch. Do not turn. Working into opposite side of ch, 1 dc in each of next 15 ch. 3 dc in last ch. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. 40 dc. 1st rnd of Stripe Pat is complete. 2nd rnd:Ch 3 (counts as dc). 1 dc in each of next 15 sps. (2 dc in next sp) 4 times. 1 dc in each of next 16 sps. (2 dc in next sp) 4 times. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. 48 dc. 3rd rnd:Ch 3 (counts as dc). 1 dc in each of next 15 sps. (2 dc in next sp. 1 dc in next sp) 3 times. 2 dc in next sp. 1 dc in each of next 17 sps. (2 dc in next sp. 1 dc in next sp) 4 times. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. 4th rnd: Ch 3 (counts as dc). 1 dc in each of next 15 sps. (2 dc in next sp. 1 dc in next 2 sps) 3 times. 2 dc in next sp. 1 dc in each of next 18 sps. (2 dc in next sp. 1 dc in next 2 sps) 4 times. 2 dc in next sp. 1 dc in each of next 2 sps. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. 5th rnd:Ch 3 (counts as dc). 1 dc in each of next 15 sps. (2 dc in next sp. 1 dc in next 3 sps) 3 times. 2 dc in next sp. 1 dc in each of next 19 sps. (2 dc in next sp. 1 dc in next 3 sps) 4 times. 2 dc in next sp. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. 6th rnd:Ch 3 (counts as dc). 1 dc in each of next 15 sps. (2 dc in next sp. 1 dc in next 4 sps) 3 times. 2 dc in next sp. 1 dc in each of next 20 sps. (2 dc in next sp. 1 dc in next 4 sps) 4 times. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. 7th rnd:Ch 3 (counts as dc). 1 dc in each of next 15 sps. (2 dc in next sp. 1 dc in next 5 sps) 3 times. 2 dc in next sp. 1 dc in each of next 21 sps. (2 dc in next sp. 1 dc in next 5 sps) 4 times. Keeping cont of Stripe Pat, AT SAME TIME inc 8 sts each rnd as established, until 19 rnds of Stripe Pat are complete. 184 dc. Next rnd:With B, ch 1. Work 1 sc in each sp around. Join with sl st to ﬁrst sc. Fasten off.

materials: RED HEART Crochet Nylon, 100% Nylon Size 18: 2 tubes 53 Teal
Susan Bates Crochet Hook: 4mm [US G-6]
Yarn needle
abbreviations: () = work directions in parentheses into same st
[] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated
measurements: Mat measures about 16 inches (40.5 cm) in diameter.
gauge: 14 sts = 4 inches (10 cm) in single crochet (sc).
instructions:
MAT
Round 1 (right side): Ch 2, work 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook; join with slip st in first sc—6 sc. Round 2: Ch 1, 2 sc in same st as joining, 2 sc in each st around; join with slip st in first sc—12 sc. Round 3: Ch 3 (counts as dc here and throughout), sc in same st as joining, *dc in next st, (sc, dc) in next st, sc in next st, (dc, sc) in next st; repeat from * to last 3 sts, dc in next st, (sc, dc) in next st, sc in last st; join with slip st in top of beginning ch-3—18 sts. Round 4: Ch 1, 2 sc in same st as joining, *dc in next st, sc in next st, 2 dc in next st, sc in next st, dc in next st **, 2 sc in next st; repeat from * around ending last repeat at **; join with slip st in first sc—24 sts. Round 5: Ch 3, sc in same st as joining, *dc in next st, sc in next st, dc in next st, (sc, dc) in next st, sc in next st, dc in next st, sc in next st **, (dc, sc) in next st; repeat from * around ending last repeat at **; join with slip st in top of beginning ch-3—30 sts.Round 6: Ch 1, 2 sc in same st as joining, *[dc in next st, sc in next st] twice, 2 dc in next st, [sc in next st, dc in next st] twice **, 2 sc in next st; repeat from * around ending last repeat at **; join with slip st in first sc—36 sts. Round 7: Ch 3, sc in same st as joining, *[dc in next st, sc in next st] twice, dc in next st, (sc, dc) in next st, [sc in next st, dc in next st] twice, sc in next st **, (dc, sc) in next st; repeat from * around ending last repeat at **; join with slip st in top of beginning ch-3—42 sts. Round 8: Ch 1, 2 sc in same st as joining, *[dc in next st, sc in next st] 3 times, 2 dc in next st, [sc in next st, dc in next st] 3 times **, 2 sc in next st; repeat from * around ending last repeat at **; join with slip st in first sc—48 sts. Round 9: Ch 3, sc in same st as joining, *[dc in next st, sc in next st] 3 times, dc in next st, (sc, dc) in next st, [sc in next st, dc in next st] 3 times, sc in next st **, (dc, sc) in next st; repeat from * around ending last repeat at **; join with slip st in top of beginning ch-3—54 sts. Round 10: Ch 1, 2 sc in same st as joining, *[dc in next st, sc in next st] 4 times, 2 dc in next st, [sc in next st, dc in next st] 4 times **, 2 sc in next st; repeat from * around ending last repeat at **; join with slip st in first sc—60 sts. Round 11: Ch 3, sc in same st as joining, *[dc in next st, sc in next st] 4 times, dc in next st, (sc, dc) in next st, [sc in next st, dc in next st] 4 times, sc in next st **, (dc, sc) in next st; repeat from * around ending last repeat at **; join with slip st in top of beginning ch-3—66 sts.Round 12: Ch 1, 2 sc in same st as joining, *[dc in next st, sc in next st] 5 times, 2 dc in next st, [sc in next st, dc in next st] 5 times **, 2 sc in next st; repeat from * around ending last repeat at **; join with slip st in first sc—72 sts. Round 13: Ch 3, sc in same st as joining, *[dc in next st, sc in next st] 5 times, dc in next st, (sc, dc) in next st, [sc in next st, dc in next st] 5 times, sc in next st **, (dc, sc) in next st; repeat from * around ending last repeat at **; join with slip st in top of beginning ch-3—78 sts. Round 14: Ch 1, 2 sc in same st as joining, *[dc in next st, sc in next st] 6 times, 2 dc in next st, [sc in next st, dc in next st] 6 times **, 2 sc in next st; repeat from * around ending last repeat at **; join with slip st in first sc—84 sts. Round 15: Ch 3, sc in same st as joining, *[dc in next st, sc in next st] 6 times, dc in next st, (sc, dc) in next st, [sc in next st, dc in next st] 6 times, sc in next st **, (dc, sc) in next st; repeat from * around ending last repeat at **; join with slip st in top of beginning ch-3—90 sts. Round 16: Ch 1, 2 sc in same st as joining, *[dc in next st, sc in next st] 7 times, 2 dc in next st, [sc in next st, dc in next st] 7 times **, 2 sc in next st; repeat from * around ending last repeat at **; join with slip st in first sc—96 sts. Round 17: Ch 4 (counts as dc, ch 1 here and throughout), dc in same st as joining, *[ch 1, skip next st, dc in next st] 7 times, ch 1, skip next st **, (dc, ch 1, dc) in next st; repeat from * around ending last repeat at **; join with slip st in 3rd ch of beginning ch-4—54 dc and 54 ch-1 spaces. Round 18: (Slip st, ch 4, dc) in first ch-1 space, *[ch 1, skip next st, dc in next ch-1 space] 8 times, ch 1, skip next st **, (dc, ch 1, dc) in next ch-1 space; repeat from * around ending last repeat at **; join with slip st in 3rd ch of beginning ch- 4—60 dc and 60 ch-1 spaces. Round 19: (Slip st, ch 4, dc) in first ch-1 space, *[ch 1, skip next st, dc in next ch-1 space] 9 times, ch 1, skip next st **, (dc, ch 1, dc) in next ch-1 space; repeat from * around ending last repeat at **; join with slip st in 3rd ch of beginning ch- 4—66 dc and 66 ch-1 spaces. Round 20: (Slip st, ch 4, dc) in first ch-1 space, *[ch 1, skip next st, dc in next ch-1 space] 10 times, ch 1, skip next st **, (dc, ch 1, dc) in next ch-1 space; repeat from * around ending last repeat at **; join with slip st in 3rd ch of beginning ch- 4—72 dc and 72 ch-1 spaces. Round 21: (Slip st, ch 4, dc) in first ch-1 space, *[ch 1, skip next st, dc in next ch-1 space] 11 times, ch 1, skip next st **, (dc, ch 1, dc) in next ch-1 space; repeat from * around ending last repeat at **; join with slip st in 3rd ch of beginning ch- 4—78 dc and 78 ch-1 spaces. Round 22: (Slip st, ch 4, dc) in first ch-1 space, *[ch 1, skip next st, dc in next ch-1 space] 12 times, ch 1, skip next st **, (dc, ch 1, dc) in next ch-1 space; repeat from * around ending last repeat at **; join with slip st in 3rd ch of beginning ch- 4—84 dc and 84 ch-1 spaces. Round 23: Ch 1, sc in first ch-1 space, sc in each dc and ch-1 space around; join with slip st in first sc—168 sc. Round 24: Ch 3 (counts as dc), skip next 2 sc, dc in next sc; working in front of dc just made, dc in 2nd skipped sc (cross- dc made), *skip next sc, dc in next sc; working in front of dc just made, dc in skipped sc (cross-dc made); repeat from * around; working behind beginning ch- 3, dc in first skipped sc of round; join with slip st in top of beginning ch-3—84 cross-dc. Round 25: Ch 2 (counts as hdc), hdc in each dc around; join with slip st in top of beginning ch-2. Round 26: Ch 1, reverse sc in each st around; join with slip st in beginning ch-1. Fasten off. FINISHING Weave in ends. Block lightly.

abbreviations: ch = chain; dc = double crochet; sc = single crochet; st(s) = stitch(es); tr = treble (triple) crochet; yo = yarn over hook; ( ) = work directions in parentheses into same st; [ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified; * = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated. Special Stitches beg tr cl (beginning treble crochet cluster) (worked over 4 stitches) = Ch 3, *yo twice, insert hook in next stitch, yo and draw up a loop, [yo and draw through 2 loops on hook] twice; repeat from * 3 more times, yo and draw through all 5 loops on hook. picot = Ch 2, sc in back bar of second ch from hook. tr cl (treble crochet cluster) (worked over 5 stitches) = Yo twice, insert hook in first stitch, yo and draw up a loop, [yo and draw through 2 loops on hook] twice, *yo twice, insert hook in next st, yo and draw up a loop, [yo and draw through 2 loops on hook] twice; repeat from * 3 more times, yo and draw through all 6 loops on hook. Special Technique Adjustable-ring = Wrap yarn into a ring, ensuring that the tail falls behind the working yarn. Grip ring and tail firmly between middle finger and thumb. Insert hook through center of ring, yarn over (with working yarn) and draw up a loop. Work stitches of first round in the ring. After the first round of stitches is worked, pull gently, but firmly, on tail to tighten ring.

RUG
Make an adjustable ring. Round 1 (right side): Ch 3 (counts as first dc here and throughout), 15 dc in ring; join with slip st in top of beginning ch-3 – 16 dc. Round 2: Ch 6 (counts as first dc and ch 3), skip next dc, *dc in next dc, ch 3, skip next dc; repeat from * around; join with slip st to 3rd ch of beginning ch-6 – 8 dc, 8 ch-3 spaces. Round 3: Slip st in first ch-3 space, ch 3, 4 dc in same ch-3 space, 5 dc in each ch-3 space; join with slip st in top of beginning ch-3 – 40 dc. Round 4: Ch 3, dc in next 4 dc, *ch 3, dc in next 5 dc; repeat from * around, ch 3; join with slip st in top of beginning ch-3 – 40 dc, 8 ch-3 spaces. Round 5: Beg tr cl, *ch 7, sc in next ch-3 space, ch 7, tr cl; repeat from * around, ch 3, tr in top of beginning ch-3 of beg tr cl – 1 beg tr cl, 8 tr cl, 16 ch-7 spaces, 8 sc. Round 6: Ch 3, 2 dc in first ch-7 space, *ch 3, 5 dc in next ch-7 space, ch 1, 5 dc in next ch-7 space; repeat from * around, ch 1, 2 dc in first ch-7 space; join with slip st in top of beginning ch-3 – 80 dc, 8 ch-3 spaces, 8 ch-1 spaces. Round 7: *Ch 7, sc in center dc of next 5-dc cluster; repeat from * around, ch 7, join with slip st to first ch – 16 ch-7 spaces, 15 sc. Round 8: Slip st into first ch-7 space, ch 3, 4 dc in same space, *ch 3, 5 dc in next ch-7 space; repeat from * around, ch 3, join with slip st in top of first ch 3 – 80 dc, 17 ch-3 spaces. Rounds 9-14: Repeat Rounds 7 and 8 – 95 dc, 20 ch-3 spaces at end of Round 14. Round 15: Ch 3, 4 dc in same dc as joining, skip next dc, sc in next dc, *(sc, picot, sc) in next ch-3 space, sc in next dc, skip next dc, 5 dc in next dc, skip next dc, sc in next dc; repeat from * around to last ch-3 space, (sc, picot, sc) in last ch-3 space; join with slip st in top of beginning ch-3 – 20 (sc, picot, sc) groups, 95 dc, 37 sc. Fasten off. FINISHING With small crochet hook or large-eyed tapestry needle, weave in ends.

instructions:
With A, ch 79.
Row 1 (right side): Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across, turn—78 st.
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in each sc; change to B, turn.
Row 3: Ch 1, sc in first 2 sc, sc in back loops only of next 2 sc, *sc in next 4 sc, sc in back loops only of next 2 sc; repeat from * to last 2 sc, sc in last 2 sc, turn.
Row 4: Ch 1, sc in each sc; change to A, turn.
Row 5: Ch 1, sc in first 2 sc, tr in front loops only of next 2 sc 2 rows below, *sc in next 4 sc, tr in front loops only of next 2 sc 2 rows below; repeat from * to last 2 sc, sc in last 2 sc, turn.
Rows 6–8: Ch 1, sc in each sc; change to B at end of Row 8, turn.
Row 9: Ch 1, sc in first 5 sc, sc in back loops only of next 2 sc, *sc in next 4 sc, sc in back loops only of next 2 sc; repeat from * to last 5 sc, sc in last 5 sc, turn.
Row 10: Ch 1, sc in each sc; change to A, turn.
Row 11: Ch 1, sc in first 5 sc, tr in front loops only of next 2 sc 2 rows below, *sc in next 4 sc, tr in front loops only of next 2 sc 2 rows below; repeat from * to last 5 sc, sc in last 5 sc, turn.
Rows 12–14: Ch 1, sc in each sc; change to B at end of Row 14, turn.
Rows 13–48: Repeat Rows 3–14 three times.
Rows 49–52: Repeat Rows 3–6 once, turn. Do not fasten off. Continue working in joined rounds with right side facing at all times.
Border
With right side facing, join A with slip st in first sc.
Round 1 (right side): Ch 3 (counts as first dc here and throughout), 2 dc in first sc (corner made), dc in each sc to last sc, 3 dc in last sc (corner made); working across ends of rows of first side, skip first row, dc in next 6 rows, *[skip next row, dc in next 7 rows] twice, skip next row, dc in next 6 rows*; repeat from * to * once, skip last row; working across opposite side of foundation ch, 3 dc in first ch (corner made), dc in each ch to last ch, 3 dc in last ch (corner made); working across ends of rows of 2nd side, skip first row, dc in next 6 rows; repeat from * to * once, skip last row; join with slip st in top of beginning ch-3—256 dc.
Rounds 2 and 3: Slip st in next dc, ch 3, 2 dc in same st, *[fpdc around next dc, bpdc around next dc] across to center dc of next corner, 3 dc in center dc, [bpdc around next dc, fpdc around next dc] across to center dc of next corner,* 3 dc in center dc; repeat from * to * once; join with slip st in top of beginning ch-3—272 dc.
Round 4: Slip st in each dc; join with slip st to first slip st. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Weave in ends.

instructions:
CROCHET MOSS STITCH SQUARE
With Color 1, chain (ch) 14.
Square 1: Make 8 using A as Color 1 and B as Color 2.
Square 2: Make 7 using B as Color 1 and A as Color 2. 1st row: [Right side (RS)]. 1 single crochet (sc) in 2nd ch from hook. *Ch 1. Skip next ch. 1 sc in next ch. Repeat (rep) from * to end of ch. Turn. 7 sc and 6 ch-1 spaces (sps).
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. *Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * to last sc. 1 sc in last sc. Join Color 2 at end of row. Turn. 3rd row: With Color 2, ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. *Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * to last 2 sc. Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in last sc. Turn. 4th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. *Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * to last sc. 1 sc in last sc. Join Color 1 at end of row. Turn. 5th and 6th rows: With Color 1, as 3rd and 4th rows. Join Color 2 at end of 6th row. Rep 3rd to 6th rows twice more. 14 rows worked total. Fasten off at end of last row. JOIN MOTIFS Make Strips: With RS facing, hold Squares 1 and 2 together (tog), aligning sides and alternating rotation of Squares to create Parquet pattern (pat), join as follows: Join Squares: Join A with slip stitch (sl st) to top of Squares at top right edge. Ch 1. Working through both thicknesses, work 1 row of sc evenly along Squares to join. Fasten off at end of row. Strip A: Make 2 Strips of 5 Squares in following sequence: (1,2,1,2,1) Strip B: Make 1 Strip of 5 Squares in following sequence: (2,1,2,1,2) Join Strips: With RS of Strips A and B facing, join A with sl st at top right edge. Ch 1. Working through both thicknesses, work 1 row of sc evenly along Strips to join. Fasten off at end of row. BORDER With RS facing, join A with sl st to any corner of Rug. Ch 1. Work 1 round (rnd) of sc evenly around 4 sides of Rug, working 3 sc in each corner. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off. Weave in ends.

instructions: Rnd 1: With CA, ch 5. Join ch with a sl st, forming a ring. Rnd 2: From right side, join CB with a sl st in any corner ch-2 sp, ch 3 (counts as 1 dc), work (2 dc, ch 2, 3 dc) in same ch-2 sp, [work (3 dc, ch 2, 3 dc) in next corner ch-2 sp] 3 times, join round with a sl st in top of beg ch-3. Fasten off. GRANNY SQUARE 2 (Make 40): Work as for granny square 1 in color sequence as follows: Rnd 1: Use CB. Rnd 2: Use CA. FINISHING Weave in all loose ends. Referring to the assembly diagram, begin to join rows of 9 squares together as follows: place a granny square 1 and a granny square 2 together, right sides facing and edges even. Working through first front lp of square at front and correspon- ding back lp of square at back, join CA with a sl st. Continue to sl st in each front lp and corresponding back lp across. Join 9 blocks to make 1 row; make 9 rows, then join rows together. EDGING: Rnd 1: With right side facing, join CA with a sl st in any corner ch-2 sp, ch 3 (counts as first dc), work 4 dc in same ch-2 sp, continue to dc in each dc and each ch-sp on each side of each joining seam around, and working 5 dc in each rem corner ch-2 sp, join round with a sl st in top of beg ch-3. Fasten off. Rnd 2: With right side facing, join CB with a sl st in same sp as joining, ch 1, *sc in next 2 sts, ch 3, sl st in last sc made (picot made); rep from * around, join round with a sl st in first sc. Fasten off. Weave in any rem loose ends.

• To join new color, work to last 2 (3) loops on hook of previous color. Yoh with new color, draw through rem loops and proceed with new color.

    • Ch 3 at beg of row counts as dc.

    Stripe Pat
    With A, work 1 row.
    With B, work 1 row.
    With C, work 1 row.
    These 3 rows form Stripe Pat.
    With A, beg using magic ring method, demonstrated here. 
    1st row (RS): Ch 3. 7 dc in ring. Cinch ring. Turn. 8 dc.
    2nd row: With B, ch 3. 1 dcfl in first st. 1 dcfl in next st. 3 dcfl in next st. PM in center of these 3 sts. 1 dcfl in each of next 2 sts. 3 dcfl in next st. PM in center of these 3 st) twice. 1 dcbl in each st to last st. 2 dcbl in last st. Turn. 20 dc. 4th row: Ch 3. 1 dcfl in first st. (1 dcfl in each st to marked st. 3 dcfl in marked st. Pm in center of these 3 sts) twice. 1 dcbl in each st to last st. 2 dcfl in last st. Turn. 20 dc. 5th to 21st rows: Keeping cont of Stripe Pat, rep 3rd and 4th rows, ending on a 3rd row. Do not turn. (1 scbl in each st to marked st. 3 scbl in marked st) twice. 1 scbl in each st to last st. 2 scbl in last st. Ch 2. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.

instructions:
Notes
• Door Mat is worked holding
3 strands of yarn tog
throughout.
• Carry color not in use loosely
up side edge of work.
With 3 strands of A held tog, ch 78.
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from 
hook. *Ch 1. Skip next ch. 1 sc 
in next sc. Rep from * to end of 
chain. Turn. 77 sts.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. *1 sc 
in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Skip next sc. 
Rep from * to last 2 sts. 1 sc in next 
ch-1 sp. 1 sc in last sc. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc.  
*Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in next
ch-1 sp. Rep from * to last 2 sc.

Turn.
Last 2 rows form pat. 
Cont in pat, working 4 rows each

Rep for opposite side.

Turn. 24 dc. 5th row: Ch 3. 1 dc in first dc. *1 dc in each of next 3 dc. 2 dc in next dc. Rep from * to last 3 dc. 1 dc in each of last 3 dc. Turn. 30 dc. 6th row: Ch 3. 1 dc in first dc. *1 dc in each of next 4 dc. 2 dc in next dc. Rep from * to last 4 dc. 1 dc in each of last 4 dc. Turn. 36 dc. 7th row: Ch 3. 1 dc in first dc. *1 dc in each of next 5 dc. 2 dc in next dc. Rep from * to last 5 dc. 1 dc in each of last 5 dc. Turn. 42 dc. 8th row: Ch 3. 1 dc in first dc. *1 dc in each of next 6 dc. 2 dc in next dc. Rep from * to last 6 dc. 1 dc in each of last 6 dc. Do not break A. Join B. Turn. 48 dc. 9th row: (RS). Fasten off. DOILY #3 (make 3) Make 3 doilies following doily #3 instructions, using thread colors and hook sizes listed below. Piece 2: Use C and larger hook. Piece 13: Use B and larger hook. Piece 14: Use A and larger hook. Ch 7; join with slip st in first ch to form a ring. 1st rnd: Ch 3, 23 dc in ring; join— 24 dc. 2nd rnd: Ch 3, dc in first dc, *ch 3, skip next dc, 2 dc next dc; repeat from * to last dc, ch 3, skip last dc; join— 24 dc and 12 ch-3 spaces. 3rd rnd: Slip st in next dc and first ch-3 space, ch 3, 4 dc in same ch-3 space, [ch 1, 5 dc in nextch-3 space] 11 times, ch 1; join—60 dc and 12 ch-1 spaces. 4th rnd: (Slip st, ch 1, sc) in last ch-1 space, ch 6, *sc in next ch-1 space, ch 6; repeat from * around; join—12 sc and 12 ch-6 spaces. Fasten off. 5th rnd: Join yarn with slip st in any ch-6 space, (beg 3-dc Cl, ch 3, 3-dc Cl) in same ch-6 space, ch 3, *(3-dc Cl, ch 3, 3-dc Cl) in next ch-6 space, ch 3; rep from * around; join— Twenty-four 3-dc Cl and 24 ch-3 spaces. 6th rnd: Sl st in next ch-3 sp. Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as sl st. *Ch 6. 1 sc in next ch-3 sp. Rep from * around. Ch 6. Join. 24 Ch-6 sps. 7th rnd: *(8 dc. picot-in st. 8 dc) in next ch-6 sp. (1 sc in next ch-6 sp. Fasten off. DOILY #5 (make 2) Make 2 doilies following doily #5 instructions, using the thread colors and hook sizes listed below. Piece 4: Use A and larger hook. Piece 7: Use B and smaller hook. join—36 dc, 6 ch-3 spaces, and 6 ch-2 spaces. 3rd rnd: Ch 3, dc in next 2 dc, ch 3, sc in next ch-3 space, ch 3, dc in next 3 dc, [ch 2, dc in next 3 dc, ch 3, sc in next ch-3 space, ch 3, dc in next 3 dc] 5 times, ch 2; materials: Bernat® Handicrafter® Cotton (Twists: 1.5 oz/42.5 g; 68 yds/62 m; Solids: 1.75 oz/50 g; 80 yds/73 m)

Contrast A Hot Green (13712) 2 balls
Contrast B White (00001) 7 balls
Size U.S. J 10 (6 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Dcfp = Yoh and draw up a loop around post of next st at front of work inserting hook from right to left. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice
gauge: 10 sc and 11 rows = 4" [10 cm]
instructions:
Center Section: With MC, ch 42.
1st row: (WS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 41 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. *1 tr in next sc. 1 sc in next sc (push long post of previous tr to front of work). Rep from * to end of row. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st to end of row. Turn. 4th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 2 sc. *1 tr in next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * to last sc. 1 sc in last sc. Turn.
5th row: As 3rd row. Turn. Rep last 4 rows until work from beg measures 12 ins [30.5 cm], ending with 3rd or 5th row. Fasten off. Note: Join all rnds of Edging with sl st to first st. Edging 1st rnd: (RS). Join A with sl st to top right corner. Ch 2 (does not count as st). 1 sc in each of next 40 sc. 3 sc in last sc (corner). 28 sc down left side to bottom corner. 3 sc in corner. 1 sc in each of next. 39 rem loops of foundation ch. 3 sc in next st. 28 sc up right side to top corner. 2 sc in first sc. Join. Turn. 2nd rnd: (WS). Ch 1. Working in back loops only, *1 sc in each sc to corner sc. 3 sc in corner sc. Rep from * around. Join. Turn. 3rd rnd: (RS). Ch 1. Working in back loops only, *1 sc in each sc to corner sc. 3 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join B. Do not turn. 4th rnd: With B, ch 3. Working in both loops, *1 hdc in each sc to corner sc. (1 hdc. Ch 8. 1 hdc) in corner sc. Rep from * around. Join. 5th rnd: Ch 2. 1 dcfp in each st to last hdc before ch‑8 sp. (1 hdc. 1 dcfp) in next hdc. Ch 8. (1 hdc. 1 dcfp) in next hdc. Rep from * around. Join. Rep last rnd for 4" [10 cm] total, having 2 more sts at each corner on every rnd. Next rnd: Ch 2. *1 dcfp in each st to last hdc before ch‑8 sp. (1 hdc. 1 dcfp) in next hdc. Ch 8. (1 hdc. 1 dcfp) in next hdc. Rep from * around. Join. Pull ch‑8 loops as follows: from 5th rnd through 4th rnd, from 6th rnd through 5th rnd, from 7th rnd through 6th rnd, from 8th rnd through 7th rnd. Rep in same manner for all ch‑8 loops of rem rnds as shown in picture. Next rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each st to 1 hdc before ch‑8 sp. 2 sc in next hdc. 5 sc in next ch‑8 sp. 2 sc in next hdc. Rep from * around. Join. Next rnd: Ch 1. Working from left to right, instead of from right to left as usual, work 1 reverse sc in each sc around. Join. Fasten off.

materials: RED HEART® Scrubby Cotton™:  4 balls 7105 Loofa A, 2 balls each 7625 Fiji B and 7365 Tan C

Yarn Needle
abbreviations: Bobble: [Yarn over, insert hook in indicated stitch, yarn over and pull up loop, yarn over, draw through 2 loops] 5 times, yarn over, draw through all loops on hook, ch 1
A = Color A, B = Color B, C = Color C, ch = chain, cm = centimeters, mm = millimeters, sc = single crochet, st(s) = stitch(es), * or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated
measurements: Mat measures 28½" [72 cm] long x 20½" [52 cm] wide
gauge: 12 sts = 4" [10 cm]; 12 rows = 4" [10 cm] in Bobble stitch. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
BATH MAT
With B, ch 63. Row 1 (Right Side): Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across – 62 sc. Row 2: Ch 3 (does not count as a stitch here and throughout), turn, Bobble in first st, sc in next st, *Bobble in next st, sc in next st; repeat from * across. Row 3: Ch 1, turn, sc in each st across – 62 sc. Rows 4-5: Repeat Rows 2-3. Cut B. Rows 6-11: Join A and repeat Rows 2-3. Cut A. Rows 12-15: Join C and repeat Rows 2-3. Cut C. Rows 16-21: Join A and repeat Rows 2-3. Cut A and join B. Repeat Row 2-21 for three more times. Join B and repeat Rows 2-5. Fasten off. FINISHING Weave in ends.

instructions: With 4 strands tog, cast on 53 sts. 1st row: (RS). K1. *P1. K1. Rep from * to end of row. Rep last row of Seed St Pat 11 times more. Round 3: Join A in back loop of beginning sc 2 rounds below (Round 1), ch 1, 2 sc in back loop of beginning sc, sc in back loop of next 37 sc, 2 sc in back loop of next 3 sc, sc in back loop of next 37 sc, 2 sc in back loop of next 2 sc, join with slip st to top of beginning sc – 86 sc. Round 8: Repeat Round 5. Round 9: With A, repeat Round 6. Round 10: Ch 1, working in both loops, sc in next 52 sc, 2 sc in next 3 sc, sc in next 53 sc, 2 sc in next 3 sc, sc in next sc, join with slip st I front loop of beginning sc. Round 11: Repeat Round 5. Round 12: With B, repeat Round 6. Round 13: Ch 1, working in both loops, sc in next 53 sc, 2 sc in next 5 sc, sc in next 54 sc, 2 sc in next 5 sc, sc in next sc, join with slip st in front loop of beginning sc. Round 14: Repeat Round 5. Round 15: With A, repeat Round 6. Round 16: Ch 1, working in both loops, sc in each sc around, join with slip st in front loop of beginning sc. Round 17: Repeat Round 5. Round 18: With B, join in back loop of beginning sc 2 rounds below (Round 16) ch 1, *sc in back loop of next 54 sc, (2 sc in back loop of next sc, sc in back loop of next sc) 5 times, repeat from * around, join with slip st in beginning sc. Round 19: Repeat Round 16. Round 20: Repeat Round 5. Round 21: With A, join in back loop of beginning sc, ch 1, 2 sc in back loop of beginning sc, sc in next sc, (2 sc in back loop of next sc, sc in back loop of next sc) 3 times, sc in back loop of next 37 sc, (2 sc in back loop of next sc, sc in back loop of next sc) 16 times, sc in back loop of next 37 sc, (2 sc in back loop of next sc, sc in back loop of next sc) 12 times, join with slip st in beginning sc. Round 22: Repeat Round 16. Round 23: Repeat Round 2. Round 24: With B, repeat Round 6. Round 25: Repeat Round 16. Round 26: Repeat Round 2. Round 27: With A, repeat Round 6. Round 28: Ch 1, *sc in next 61 sc, (2 sc in next sc, sc in next sc) 12 times, repeat from * around, join with slip st in front loop of beginning sc. Round 29: Repeat Round 5. Round 30: With B, repeat Round 6. Round 31: Repeat Round 16. Round 32: Repeat Round 5. Round 33: With A, repeat Round 6. Round 34: Repeat Round 16. Round 35: Repeat Round 5. Round 36: With B, join in back loop of first sc 2 rounds below (Round 34), ch 1, 2 sc in back loop of beginning sc, *sc in back loop of next 7 sc, 2 sc in back loop of next sc, repeat from * around to last sc, sc in back loop of last sc, join with slip st to beginning sc. Round 37: Repeat Round 16. Round 38: Repeat Round 2. Round 39: With A, repeat Round 6. Round 40: Ch 1, working in both loops, 2 sc in beginning sc, * sc in next 5 sc, 2 sc in next sc, repeat from* around to last 2 sc, sc in last 2 sc, join with slip st in front loop of beginning sc. Round 41: Repeat Round 5. Round 42: With B, repeat Round 6. Round 43: Repeat Round 16. Round 44: Repeat Round 5. Round 45: With A, repeat Round 6. Round 46: Repeat Round 16. Round 47: Repeat Round 5. materials: RED HEART® Super Saver®: 2 skeins each of 530 Orchid A and 3945 Blue Suede D, 1 skein each of 512 Turqua B and 505 Aruba Sea C, Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 9mm [US M-13], Yarn needle
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, B, C; ch = chain; dc = double crochet; mm = millimeters; sc = single crochet; st(s) = stitch(es); yo = yarn over;  [ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified; * or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated;
C2dc (Crossed 2 Double Crochet): Skip next st, dc in next st, working in front of st just made, dc in skipped st.
gauge: 9 sts = 4” [10cm]; 8 rows
instructions: Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and each ch across; turn – 82 sc. Row 2: Ch 1, sc in each st across. Row 3: Change to 2 strands of A, ch 3, turn, *[C2dc] 5 times, sc in next 10 sts; repeat from * 3 more times, sc in last st. Row 4: Ch 1, turn, sc in first st, *sc in next 10 sts, [C2dc] 5 times; repeat from * 3 more times, dc in last st. Cut A. Rows 5-6: Change to 2 strands of D, ch 1, turn, sc in each st across. Row 7: Change to 2 strands of B, ch 1, turn, sc in first st, *sc in next 10 sts, [C2dc] 5 times, repeat from * 3 more times, dc in last st. Row 8: Ch 3, turn, *[C2dc] 5 times, sc in next 10 sts; repeat from * 3 more times, sc in last st. Cut B. Rows 9-10: Change to 2 strands of D and repeat Rows 5 and 6. Rows 11-12: Change to 2 strands of A and repeat Rows 3-4. Cut A. Rows 13-14: Change to 2 strands of D and repeat Rows 5-6. Rows 15-16: Change to 2 strands of C and repeat Rows 7-8. Cut C. Rows 17-18: Change to 2 strands of D and repeat Rows 5-6. Repeat Rows 3-18 once more, then repeat Rows 3-14. Fasten off. FINISHING Side Edging Row 1: Join 2 strands of D in D-st in one corner ready to work along one long edge, ch 1, sc evenly spaced along long edge to D-st at next corner. Row 2: Ch 1, turn, sc in each st across. Fasten off. Repeat along opposite side edge. Weave in ends.

instructions:
Rug (See chart on page 2)
Left Side: With 2 strands of yarn and pair of needles, cast on 4 sts. 1st row: (RS). (P1. K1) twice. 2nd row: Inc 1 in /f_irst st. P1. K1. P1. 5 sts. 3rd row: Cast on 4 sts. *P1. K1. Rep from * to last st. Inc 1 in last st. 10 sts. Last 2 rows form Seed St Pat.  4th row: Inc 1 in /f_irst st. Pat to end of row. 11 sts. 5th row: As 3rd row. 16 sts. 6th row: *K1. P1. Rep from * to end of row.  7th row: Cast on 4 sts. *P1. K1. Rep from * to end of row. 20 sts. 8th row: ssk. *K1. P1. Rep from * to end of row. 19 sts. Break yarn. Leave sts on a stitch holder. Change to circular needle and join sides, working in Seed St Pat as follows: 9th row: (RS). Pat across 19 sts of Right Side. Do not join. Cast on 3 sts. Pat across 15 sts of Center stitch holder. Cast on 3 sts. Pat across 19 sts of Left Side stitch holder. 59 sts. 10th row: Work even in pat. Dec 1 st each end of needle on next and every following 3rd row 7 times more. 43 sts rem. Work even in Seed St Pat for next 15 rows. Cont in pat, inc 1 st each end on needle on next and every following alt row 8 times more. 61 sts. Work 3 rows even. Next row: (RS). Pat across 14 sts. Cast off next 4 sts. Pat across next 25 sts. Cast off 4 sts. Pat across last 14 sts (Left Side). Shape Left Side: Next row: (WS). Pat to last 2 sts. P2tog. 13 sts. Next row: ssk. Pat to end of row. 12 sts. Rep last 2 rows once more, then 1st row once. 9 sts rem. Next row: (RS). ssk. Pat to end of row. Next row: P2tog. Pat to last 2 sts. P2tog. Rep last 2 rows once more. 3 sts rem. Cast off. Shape Head: With WS facing, rejoin 2 strands of yarn to next 25 sts. Work 2 rows even in pat. Dec 1 st each end of needle on next and every following alt row twice more. 19 sts. Work 7 rows even in pat. Dec 1 st each end of needle on next 7 rows. Cast off rem 5 sts. Shape Right Side: With WS facing, rejoin 2 strands of yarn to last 14 sts and pat to end of row. Next row: (RS). Pat to last 2 sts. K2tog. 13 sts. Next row: P2tog. Pat to end of row. 12 sts. Rep last 2 rows once more, then 1st row once. 9 sts rem. Next row: (RS). Pat to last 2 sts. K2tog. Next row: P2tog. Pat to last 2 sts. P2tog. Rep last 2 rows once more. 3 sts rem. Cast off.

instructions: RUG Ch 76. Row 1 (right side): Dc in 4th ch from hook (beginning ch count as first dc) and in each ch across, turn—74 dc. Row 2–5: Ch 2 (counts as first dc here and throughout), *fpdc around next 4 dc, bpdc around next 4 dc; repeat from * across, dc in top of beginning ch, turn. Rows 6–9: Ch 2, *bpdc around next 4 dc, fpdc around next 4 dc; repeat from * across, dc in top of beginning ch, turn. Rows 10–73: Repeat Rows 2–9 eight times. Rows 74–77: Repeat Rows 2–5. materials: Dual Duty XP Heavy Thread: 7450 Temple Gold
Dual Duty XP Heavy Thread: 8150 Spice
Dual Duty XP Heavy Thread: 900 Black
Dual Duty XP All Purpose Thread: 900 Black
Coats Metallic Thread: 440 Gold or 9450 Copper
Black Felt: 1/2 yard
Sewing Machine
Leaf and Acorn patterns
Topstitching needle: size 18 (110)
instructions: Cut one (1) 16 inch circle from black felt. Trace and cut out leaf patterns. Trace and cut out 3 acorn patterns. Arrange and pin paper patterns as desired at least 1 inch from circle edge. Thread machine with first color Dual Duty XP Heavy on top and black XP All Purpose thread in the bobbin. Using a zipper foot stitch around the leaf paper patterns using a 3.7 mm stitch length. Use a 3.1 mm stitch around the acorns. Remove paper pattern pieces. Pull threads to back and tie. Loosely stitch around the first thread outline with another shade of Dual Duty XP Heavy thread. Pull threads to back and tie. Thread top of machine with Coats Metallic thread for the final row of stitches. Pull to the back and tie. Press to remove any puckers or wrinkles. Place circle right side up on remaining felt. Pin and cut backing for candle mat. Finish the outer edge of the circle with a buttonhole stitch using black Dual Duty XP Heavy thread. Use the longest and widest settings on your machine. If your machine does not have a buttonhole stitch use a wide zigzag stitch.

materials: RED HEART® Vivid™: 3 balls 6761 Powerful Pink
Susan Bates® Crochet Hooks: 5mm [H-8 US] and 16mm [Q US]
Small crochet hook or large eye plastic needle (for weaving in ends)
gauge: Rounds 1 and 2 = 11” (280 cm) in diameter
instructions: Make an adjustable ring. Round 1 (right side): Ch 3 (counts as first dc here and throughout), 15 dc in ring; join with slip st in top of beginning ch-3—16 dc. Round 2: Ch 6 (counts as first dc and ch 3), skip next dc, *dc in next dc, ch 3, skip next dc; repeat from * around; join with slip st to 3rd ch of beginning ch-6—8 ch-3 sps. Round 3: Slip st in first ch-3 space, ch 3, 4 dc in same ch-3 space, 5 dc in each ch-3 space; join with slip st in top of beginning ch-3—40 dc. Round 4: Ch 3, dc in next 4 dc, *ch 3, dc in next 5 dc; repeat from * around, ch 3; join with slip st in top of beginning ch-3—40 dc and 8 ch-3 sps. Round 5: Beg tr cl, *ch 7, sc in next ch-3 space, ch 7, tr cl; repeat from * around, ch 3, tr in top of beginning ch-3 of beg tr cl—8 tr cl and 16 ch-7 sps. Round 6: Ch 3, 2 dc in first ch-7 space, *ch 3, 5 dc in next ch-7 space, ch 1, 5 dc in next ch-7 space; repeat from * around, ch 1, 2 dc in first ch-7 space; join with slip st in top of beginning ch-3—80 dc and 8 ch-3 sps. Round 7: Ch 3, 4 dc in same dc as joining, skip next dc, sc in next dc, *(sc, picot, sc) in next ch-3 space, [sc in next dc, skip next dc, 5 dc in next dc, skip next dc, sc in next dc] twice; repeat from * around to last ch-3 space, (sc, picot, sc) in last ch-3 space, sc in next dc, skip next dc, 5 dc in next dc, skip next dc, sc in next 2 dc, skip last dc; join with slip st in top of beginning ch-3—8 picots. Fasten off. FINISHING Weave in ends.
